p: In addition to the proportion of PUFA in muscle membranes, the amount of reactive oxygen species produced and the levels of endogenous or nutritional antioxidants also influence the lipid oxidation process [ 4]. Moreover, lower percentages of total lipids and saturated fatty acids and higher mono- and polyunsaturated fatty acid (PUFA), conjugated linoleic acid (CLA), and n–3 and n–6 fatty acid contents are desirable to improve the functional meat properties by increasing the nutraceutical molecule contents [ 5, 6].
